Copy.Pstm19:
Although each new day can bring fresh challenges, you may feel you're better equipped to deal with them now, and you've found your feet as a parent.

From now on, we'll be in touch every month, instead of every week, with a round-up of all the advice you need to make the most of family life.

Spending a lot on food shopping? A bit of forward planning will help to avoid food being wasted and save you lots of money. Plan your meals in advance and if you stick to a pre-planned list when you go the supermarket, it'll stop you picking up all those non essentials that are strategically placed at the end of the aisles!

And while we are on the subject of food, if you are unsure what your toddler needs for a healthy balanced diet, check out our guide to toddler nutrition.
Copy.Pstm20:
Around this age, your little one might want to assert their independence - and refuse to go to bed. Or they might wake up early and insist on staying awake. Read our advice on what you can do and find out what else you can expect around this age.

Chances are you won't be able to understand a fair bit of what your toddler says, but he or she can recognise and start to copy most of the words you say - so mind your language!

Also this month, we've got some help on understanding tantrums.
Copy.Pstm21:
Is your child ready for potty training?

Around this age, some toddlers might be ready to start potty training, although most are likely to take a while longer. How can you tell when your child is ready - what are the signs? And is there anything you can do to help prepare your little one so potty training goes as smoothly as possible?

Find out the answers, and get our top tips for potty training in this month's guide.
Copy.Pstm22:
It's time to start thinking about your toddler's 2nd birthday.

It's not long until your 'baby' turns two - so if you'd like to mark the occasion, now's a good time to start planning. You could also think ahead and make a birthday list to pass on to family if they're stuck for ideas.

This month, we've got advice on teaching your toddler the art of sharing. It's something we all have to learn at some point - but it's not always easy!
Copy.Pstm23:
Is your toddler ready to ditch the cot?

By now, your little one might be able to climb out of their cot, making a bid for freedom. If so, you might prefer to move them to a big bed. It's possible you could get a few night-time visits over the first few weeks - so you might want to start thinking about how you'll handle things.

This month, we've got more advice on how to cope with tantrums.
